member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.Items
member.summary:
Gets or sets a queryable source of data for the grid.
This could be in-memory data converted to queryable using the extension method, or an EntityFramework DataSet or an derived from it.
You should supply either or , but not both.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.ItemsProvider
member.summary:
Gets or sets a callback that supplies data for the rid.
You should supply either or , but not both.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the child components of this instance. For example, you may define columns by adding components derived from the base class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.Virtualize
member.summary:
If true, the grid will be rendered with virtualization. This is normally used in conjunction with scrolling and causes the grid to fetch and render only the data around the current scroll viewport. This can greatly improve the performance when scrolling through large data sets.
If you use , you should supply a value for and must ensure that every row renders with the same constant height.
Generally it's preferable not to use if the amount of data being rendered is small or if you are using pagination.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.OverscanCount
member.summary: This is applicable only when using . It defines how many additional items will be rendered before and after the visible region to reduce rendering frequency during scrolling. While higher values can improve scroll smoothness by rendering more items off-screen, they can also increase initial load times. Finding a balance based on your data set size and user experience requirements is recommended. The default value is 3.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.ItemSize
member.summary: This is applicable only when using . It defines an expected height in pixels for each row, allowing the virtualization mechanism to fetch the correct number of items to match the display size and to ensure accurate scrolling.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.ResizableColumns
member.summary: If true, renders draggable handles around the column headers and adds a button to invoke a resize UI. This allows the user to resize columns manually. Size changes are not persisted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.ResizeType
member.summary: To comply with WCAG 2.2, a one-click option should be offered to change column widths. We provide such an option through the ColumnOptions UI. This parameter allows you to enable or disable this resize UI.Enable it by setting the type of resize to perform Discrete: resize by a 10 pixels at a time Exact: resize to the exact width specified (in pixels) Note: This does not affect resizing by mouse dragging, just the keyboard driven resize.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.ColumnResizeLabels
member.summary: (Aria) Labels used in the column resize UI.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.ColumnSortLabels
member.summary: Labels used in the column sort UI.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.ColumnOptionsLabels
member.summary: Labels used in the column options UI.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.HeaderCellAsButtonWithMenu
member.summary: If true, enables the new style of header cell that includes a button to display all column options through a menu.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.ItemKey
member.summary:
Optionally defines a value for @key on each rendered row. Typically this should be used to specify a unique identifier, such as a primary key value, for each data item.
This allows the grid to preserve the association between row elements and data items based on their unique identifiers, even when the instances are replaced by new copies (for example, after a new query against the underlying data store).
If not set, the @key will be the instance itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid`1.Pagination
member.summary:
Optionally links this instance with a model, causing the grid to fetch and render only the current page of data.
This is normally used in conjunction with a component or some other UI logic that displays and updates the supplied instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentAutocomplete`1.Virtualize
member.summary:
If true, the options list will be rendered with virtualization. This is normally used in conjunction with scrolling and causes the option list to fetch and render only the data around the current scroll viewport. This can greatly improve the performance when scrolling through large data sets.
If you use , you should supply a value for and must ensure that every row renders with the same constant height.
Generally it's preferable not to use if the amount of data being rendered is small.

member.name: P:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentAutocomplete`1.ItemSize
member.summary: This is applicable only when using . It defines an expected height in pixels for each row, allowing the virtualization mechanism to fetch the correct number of items to match the display size and to ensure accurate scrolling.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height of the field to adjust its height in relation to selected elements.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the currently selected item from the drop-down (if it is open) is selected. Default is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the drop-down panel stays open after selecting an item, until the number of selected items reaches the maximum (only using the mouse).

member.name: M:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentOverlay.CheckRGBString
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^(?:#(?:[a-fA-F0-9]{6}|[a-fA-F0-9]{3}))
Explanation:
○ Match if at the beginning of the string.
○ Match '#'.
○ Match with 2 alternative expressions, atomically.
○ Match a character in the set [0-9A-Fa-f] exactly 6 times.
○ Match a character in the set [0-9A-Fa-f] exactly 3 times.

member.summary: The position only updates when the anchor resizes

member.name: T:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Color
member.summary: The color to use for the drawing icons, badges, etc.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Color.Neutral
member.summary: Use the '--neutral-foreground-rest' CSS variable color to draw the icon. Icon is drawn in the same color as the standard text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Color.Accent
member.summary: Use the '--accent-fill-rest' CSS variable color. This is the default value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Color.Warning
member.summary: Use the '--warning' CSS variable color. Note: This color is defined in the variables.css file. If this file is not being used, a CSS variable with this name and appropriate value needs to be created.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Color.Info
member.summary: Use the '--info' CSS variable color. Note: This color is defined in the variables.css file. If this file is not being used, a CSS variable with this name and appropriate value needs to be created.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Color.Error
member.summary: Use the '--error' CSS variable color. Note: This color is defined in the variables.css file. If this file is not being used, a CSS variable with this name and appropriate value needs to be created.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Color.Success
member.summary: Use the '--success' CSS variable color. Note: This color is defined in the variables.css file. If this file is not being used, a CSS variable with this name and appropriate value needs to be created.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Color.Fill
member.summary: Use the '--neutral-fill-rest' CSS variable color, adapts to light/dark mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Color.FillInverse
member.summary: Use the '--neutral-fill-inverse-rest' CSS variable color, adapts to light/dark mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Color.Lightweight
member.summary: Use the '--neutral-layer-1' CSS variable color, adapts to light/dark mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Color.Disabled
member.summary: Use the --neutral-stroke-rest CSS variable color, adapts to light/dark mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Color.Custom
member.summary: Supply an HTML hex color string value (#rrggbb or #rgb) for the CustomColor parameter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputFileMode
member.summary: How to handle the input file(s).

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputFileMode.SaveToTemporaryFolder
member.summary: Uploaded files are saved to a temporary folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputFileMode.Buffer
member.summary: Files are read into a buffer. Use to retrieve bytes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputFileMode.Stream
member.summary: In Blazor Server, file data is streamed over the SignalR connection into .NET code on the server as the file is read. In Blazor WebAssembly, file data is streamed directly into the .NET code within the browser.

member.name: T:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputMode
member.summary: The inputmode global attribute is an enumerated attribute that hints at the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents. This allows a browser to display an appropriate virtual keyboard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputMode.None
member.summary: No virtual keyboard. For when the page implements its own keyboard input control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputMode.Text
member.summary: Standard input keyboard for the user's current locale. (default value)

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputMode.Decimal
member.summary: Fractional numeric input keyboard containing the digits and decimal separator for the user's locale (typically . or ,). Devices may or may not show a minus key (-).

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputMode.Numeric
member.summary: Numeric input keyboard, but only requires the digits 0–9. Devices may or may not show a minus key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputMode.Telephone
member.summary: A telephone keypad input, including the digits 0–9, the asterisk (*), and the pound (#) key. Inputs that *require* a telephone number should typically use instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputMode.Search
member.summary: A virtual keyboard optimized for search input. For instance, the return/submit key may be labeled "Search", along with possible other optimizations. Inputs that require a search query should typically use instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputMode.Email
member.summary: A virtual keyboard optimized for entering email addresses. Typically includes the @character as well as other optimizations. Inputs that require email addresses should typically use instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.InputMode.Url
member.summary: A keypad optimized for entering URLs. This may have the / key more prominent, for example. Enhanced features could include history access and so on. Inputs that require a URL should typically use instead.

member.name: T:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.KeyLocation
member.summary: the location of the key on the keyboard or other input device

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.KeyLocation.Unknown
member.summary: Not defined

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.KeyLocation.Standard
member.summary: The key has only one version, or can't be distinguished between the left and right versions of the key, and was not pressed on the numeric keypad or a key that is considered to be part of the keypad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.KeyLocation.Left
member.summary: The key was the left-hand version of the key; for example, the left-hand Control key was pressed on a standard 101 key US keyboard. This value is only used for keys that have more than one possible location on the keyboard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.KeyLocation.Right
member.summary: The key was the right-hand version of the key; for example, the right-hand Control key is pressed on a standard 101 key US keyboard. This value is only used for keys that have more than one possible location on the keyboard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.KeyLocation.NumPad
member.summary: The key was on the numeric keypad, or has a virtual key code that corresponds to the numeric keypad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.KeyLocation.Mobile
member.summary: The key was on a mobile device; this can be on either a physical keypad or a virtual keyboard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.KeyLocation.Joystick
member.summary: The key was a button on a game controller or a joystick on a mobile device.

member.name: M:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Utilities.CssBuilder.GenerateValidClassNameRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^-?[_a-zA-Z]+[_a-zA-Z0-9-]*$
Options:
RegexOptions.Compiled
Explanation:
○ Match if at the beginning of the string.
○ Match '-' atomically, optionally.
○ Match a character in the set [A-Z_a-z] greedily at least once.
○ Match a character in the set [-0-9A-Z_a-z] atomically any number of times.
○ Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

member.name: T:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.Utilities.Debounce
